sense.name: one who stalks prey in order to kill it
sense.commentary: HUNTER[+entity][+organism][+killer][+prey] Note: can refer to human or animal
sense.examples: It was a small society of hunters and gatherers. The duck hunter sat patiently in the rushes with his two retrievers. Moray eels are nocturnal hunters and emerge from their holes at night.

sense.name: a person who searches for something
sense.examples: Those scuba divers are experienced hunters of sunken treasure. Bob describes himself as a hunter of the truth. The two sisters had always been avid hunters of the best bargains in town.

sense.name: a breed of horse, used for jumping and fox hunts
sense.examples: Mary rode to the hounds on a 16-hands chestnut hunter. The big black hunter easily cleared the fence and galloped through the meadow.

sense.name: a watch with a hinged lid to protect the face
sense.examples: John inherited his grandfather's hunter with the gold case. The man flicked open the lid of his hunter to find out what time it was.
